alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Tyler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 10 at 8:08PM CDT until June 10 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Jasper County in southeastern Texas... Tyler County in southeastern Texas... * Until 1115 PM CDT. * At 808 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Woodville, Warren, Town Bluff, Fred, Spurger, Magnolia Springs, Mt. Union, Ivanhoe and Hillister. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
